decks.notes: The main focus of this Pauper UB Delver deck is to quickly flip Delver of Secrets and bring out powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Striped Riverwinder while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. The deck utilizes efficient card draw and filtering with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Thought Scour to maintain tempo and find key pieces. Exhume is used to cheat out big creatures from the graveyard, providing a strong advantage. The addition of Ash Barrens helps fix mana while Dismal Backwater provides some life gain in a fast-paced aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and card advantage, using cards like Chainer's Edict, Counterspell, and Mulldrifter. It also utilizes recursion with Archaeomancer and Ghostly Flicker to generate additional value. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chittering Rats and Disfigure while establishing a strong presence on the board with creatures like Sea Gate Oracle. The mana base allows for consistent access to both blue and black mana sources to support the control game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of direct burn spells and creatures with abilities that trigger whenever a player casts a spell. By utilizing low-cost spells like Chain Lightning, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and finish off the opponent with a powerful Fireblast. The inclusion of cards like Firebrand Archer and Thermo-Alchemist help to maximize damage output while Curse of the Pierced Heart provides a recurring source of damage. The deck is designed to win swiftly and aggressively.

The foundation of this deck revolves around rapidly deploying creatures and creating a strong board presence. Utilizing cheap creatures and efficient spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and creature buffs. By generating token creatures and utilizing spells like Dynacharge and Might of the Masses, the deck can quickly amass a threatening army. The inclusion of cards like Thermo-Alchemist and Lightning Bolt also provide additional reach and removal options to close out games swiftly. The Golgari Aggro archetype focuses on proactive plays and consistent pressure to secure victories.

The deck focuses on playing artifact creatures for cheap or even free, then using those creatures as resources to buff up a powerful attacker like Atog or Gearseeker Serpent. Thoughtcast and other cards help the player draw into more creatures and spells quickly. The deck also includes removal and protection spells like Galvanic Blast and Metallic Rebuke to control the board. The mana base is heavily reliant on artifact lands and color-fixing artifacts to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main theme of this UR Control Pauper deck is to heavily control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to gradually wear down the opponent by countering their threats, removing their creatures, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of a few win conditions like Flurry of Horns and Lightning Bolt provides a way to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. The deck's mana base is designed to support the control strategy while also providing the necessary colors for casting spells.

The deck focuses on leveraging artifact synergy to quickly flood the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By efficiently deploying cheap artifacts and utilizing cards like Thoughtcast to draw more cards, it aims to swarm the opponent with a combination of resilient threats and burn spells like Galvanic Blast. With the ability to generate a significant amount of mana, the deck can quickly deploy large threats like Gearseeker Serpent to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly amass a battlefield presence with low-cost artifacts and use them to power up Atog and other creatures. By utilizing cards like Myr Enforcer and Thoughtcast, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats early in the game. In addition, cards like Temur Battle Rage and Galvanic Blast can provide burst damage to finish off opponents quickly. The deck also includes various artifact lands and mana fixing cards to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent aggression.

This deck focuses on establishing early board presence with low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant, while utilizing counterspells like Spellstutter Sprite to control the opponent's plays. Ninja of the Deep Hours provides card advantage by allowing for repeated bounce effects, and Gush helps to refuel the hand. Lightning Bolt and Skred provide direct removal options, with Snap for tempo plays. The mana base is optimized for consistency, utilizing Snow-Covered lands and Evolving Wilds. This deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly dropping low-cost artifact creatures onto the battlefield, taking advantage of their synergy with cards like Thoughtcast and Galvanic Blast to overwhelm the opponent with damage. With efficient mana-fixing and card draw, the deck aims to maintain a consistent flow of threats while using tricks like Fling and Temur Battle Rage to surprise the opponent with unexpected bursts of damage. By combining aggressive creature plays with disruptive spells, this deck aims to create a fast, high-pressure game plan to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifact creatures and take advantage of the affinity mechanic to drop powerful threats early in the game. The deck focuses on generating significant card advantage through cards like Thoughtcast and Prophetic Prism while also including ways to deal direct damage to the opponent with cards like Galvanic Blast and Fling. The inclusion of cards like Temur Battle Rage and Gearseeker Serpent allows for potential explosive turns and finishing opponents off quickly.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures with efficient mana costs and utilizing pump spells to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. By utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Nest Invader to quickly build a board presence and cards like Rancor and Hunger of the Howlpack to increase the power of the creatures, this deck aims to end the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Vault Skirge and River Boa provides additional evasion and resilience to removal spells.

This deck focuses on a aggressive strategy early on with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, supported by counter spells and removal like Spellstutter Sprite and Lightning Bolt. The deck also leverages card draw and manipulation with Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to maintain tempo. The use of Snow-Covered lands enables Skred as a flexible removal spell, while Augur of Bolas provides additional card advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan and generating card advantage for a midrange finish.

The main concept of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to rapidly deploy a board full of artifact creatures such as Atog, Carapace Forger, and Myr Enforcer using cards like Frogmite and Gearseeker Serpent. Thoughtcast helps you draw into more creatures and answers, while cards like Fling and Temur Battle Rage provide finishing moves. The deck utilizes artifact lands like Ancient Den and Great Furnace along with artifact mana producers like Springleaf Drum and Terrarion to consistently cast your threats and burn spells like Galvanic Blast. This deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and powerful board presence.

The deck focuses on using a combination of cheap counterspells, removal, and card draw to control the game. It utilizes Faerie creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Ninja of the Deep Hours to apply pressure and generate card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up efficient card draws and maintaining board presence. Snow-covered lands are included to support Skred as a removal spell. The strategy revolves around efficiently managing resources and outsmarting the opponent to gain control of the game.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Chittering Rats and Cuombajj Witches to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, alongside powerful finishers like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Crypt Rats, this deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and finish them off before they can stabilize. With a mix of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and card advantage options, this deck seeks to maintain pressure and control throughout the game.
